triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: CodePlan leverages LLMs as the core neural component for generating code edits at specific repository locations.

triples.name: Static program analysis
triples.relevance: The paper addresses fixing error reports from static analysis tools, which is a key application of CodePlan.

triples.name: Type system
triples.relevance: Adding type annotations and specifications is one of the core repository-level coding tasks that CodePlan solves.

triples.name: GitHub Copilot
triples.relevance: GitHub Copilot is cited as an example of LLM-based tools for localized coding problems that CodePlan extends to repository-level tasks.

triples.name: Automated planning and scheduling
triples.relevance: CodePlan frames repository-level coding as a planning problem using an adaptive planning algorithm as a core component.

triples.name: Dependence analysis
triples.relevance: CodePlan introduces incremental dependency analysis as a symbolic component to track code interdependencies across repositories.

triples.name: Data-flow analysis
triples.relevance: Data-flow analysis techniques underpin the dependency and impact analysis methods used in CodePlan.

triples.name: Neuro-symbolic AI
triples.relevance: CodePlan is described as a neuro-symbolic framework that combines neural LLMs with symbolic reasoning components.

triples.name: Python (programming language)
triples.relevance: Python is one of the two programming languages used in CodePlan's evaluation for temporal code edits tasks.

triples.name: C Sharp (programming language)
triples.relevance: C# is the programming language used in CodePlan's evaluation for package migration tasks.

triples.name: Code refactoring
triples.relevance: Package migration, a key application of CodePlan, is a form of code refactoring that involves pervasive repository-level changes.

triples.name: AI-assisted software development
triples.relevance: CodePlan represents an advancement in AI-assisted software development by automating complex repository-level engineering tasks.

triples.name: Repository (version control)
triples.relevance: CodePlan operates on software repositories as units of analysis, requiring understanding of inter-file code dependencies.

triples.name: Change impact analysis
triples.relevance: CodePlan implements change may-impact analysis as a core symbolic component to determine how edits propagate through the codebase.
